intro: Fimbristylis capitulifera, commonly known as the clustered flatsedge, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in moist, swampy areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, spike-like flowers. Fimbristylis capitulifera is often found in wetlands and is characterized by its delicate, flowering structure.
